msbt.message: Lately I've started exercising as a way to stay healthy.

Have you ever heard of choral exercise?You sing really, really loud, and the effort strengthens your stomach muscles. But my neighbor told me everyone can hear me when I sing in the tub, so that was a little embarrassing

I saw this new kind of workout on TV. They called it "shop-ercise" and it's all the rage! You simply go to a store and put ALL the things you want to buy in a shopping basket You make sure it's nice and heavy and then you get an amazing arm workout just by carrying it around! Shopping and exercising at the same timeâ€”I LOVE it! It's so "me" I should have invented it myself!

My friend told me about this thing called "Emotional Exercises." You MUST let me demonstrate! Here goes AH-HA! HAAAA HA HA! BOO-HOO! HEH-HEH!Anyway, that's the gist of it, .They say it's supposed to be a good workout for the facial muscles but my WHOLE body is exhausted!
The other day, I had the perfect shopping experience.
After months of looking, I found and for cheaper than usual! It's almost embarrassing how happy a find like that makes me, .

I finally got my hands on a dress I've been looking for forEVER.I was selling some old clothes at a secondhand store, and I happened to see this dress just hanging there. For a great find like that, I didn't even think before I splurged on it.

I've been looking for for ages and finally found the very one I wanted. And wouldn't you know itthere was a two-for-one sale happening! So of course I got four. For some reason, when I hear the words "buy one, get one free," I stop thinking and start spending.
I was JUST thinking about my secret guilty pleasure.

I have these aromatic bath gels I like to use when I take a bath, you see. They smell JUST like roses. But recently I tried dropping some REAL rose petals into my bathtub. And they smelled SO good!Best of all, they're less expensive than bath gels, and make me feel rich at the same time. You just HAVE to try it, !

I just LOVE buying things for the house. Interior decoration IS one of my passions, as you know. Well, after saving up my Bells, I decided to go on a bit of a spending spree, . I bought such lovely things! It was all so very exciting.But I admit, now that I'm over the excitement and my new purchases aren't so new anymore I just wish I had all the Bells I saved back again.

You know how I love shopping. And picking out perfect outfits is something I'm VERY good at. But the other day I got home and put on the new clothes I had boughtand I didn't like them at all! I confess, I hope I'm not losing my touch, !

I like a tidy house as much as the next , but cleaning gets to be such a bore, doesn't it? Also, I read in a magazine that cleaning one's home TOO often isn't very eco-friendly. That's why it's important to take a break from cleaning. It's good for us AND the environment, .

I need to be prepared for sudden- onset shopping at any time, so I always have my reusable bag on me.But having a bag makes it too easy to shop, and I end up buying stuff all the time! That's not eco-friendly!

I like cooking a nice meal as much as the next , but sometimes it can be quite the chore. Just deciding what to make every single daygoodness, it gets exhausting, don't you think? That's why I've decided to stop thinking about it altogether, . It's true! Now I just draw all of my meal ideasout of a hat!
On days when something good happens, there's something I always make sure to do.

I go out for a walk, and I pick any weeds I find.When something makes me happy, I try to spread that happy feeling to others, you see.Weeding is something I'm good at, so it's a very "me" way to share my joy with the world.

I add ONE sugar cube to my coffee, even though I normally drink it black.Drinking sweet coffee feels like a special treat for a special day.And the taste reminds me what made me happy to begin with, so I get to feel good all over again!

I write a few words about what made me happy. Then I fold up the paper and put it in a bottle. Happiness is invisible, but this makes it visible, you see?Then, when I'm feeling down, I look at all of those happy bottlesand they cheer me right up!
You know, darling, recently I've been going through all the message cards sent to me. I've been organizing them, rereading them, and what have you.

You wouldn't believe all the kind notes and admiring remarks I've receivedWhy, there are just so many to read, ! I end up staying awake far too late! Ah well, I suppose it's just the sort of burden someone like me must bear.
In fact, I've been arranging them in ordermost favorite to least favorite. Oh, you have nothing to worry about. Any card you send me will go straight to the top of the pile, .

I simply adore looking at the card designs themselves. They're all so stylishly done. And don't get me started on those limited-availability cards that change with the seasons They really are a must-have for those of us who truly appreciate fine stationery, .
A friend of mine is hosting a soiree, and I received an invite. But there's a cloud around this silver gleam

My best party dress is at the cleaner's and won't be ready in time for the event.I'd wear my second-best ensemble, but my dear friend knows both me and my wardrobe too well for that.Anything less than my finest would be an insult to our friendship! Yet what else am I to do, ?Wait. I've just had a thought. It's outlandish, but perhapsI could tell her what happened.Perfect! Oh, , you've done it again!

My housewarming-gift plans are dashed! Her favorite chocolaterie STILL doesn't take online orders. I'll have to buy in person on the day of the party. Is there a flight early enough to get me there and back?

The hostess's birthday is soon, and I thought a surprise gift might be an aggressively generous move.But what to get the woman who has everything? I do recall her saying she needed Perhaps I'll see what I can scrounge up at the Nook Stop, .
You know, I've been thinking a lot lately about the very best qualities my friends possess. Meaning you!
For instance, I adore that you're always up for a quick chat.An island like this could get lonely without a good friend like you to keep me company, .

For instance, it simply tickles me the way you constantly run around outside, !The utter joy you exhibit frolicking around our island emboldens me to leave my own home every so often.Sothank you for that!
For instance, I very much appreciate that you have a pleasant indoor speaking voice. You're not, like<10_10 />BLAH BLAH BLAH!<10_9 />Like some residents of that shall go unnamed, .

For instance, I am always impressed by your ability to get along so well with everyone on this island.Not that I play favorites. Well, you're my favorite. <10_4 />But I won't name names of anyone in any other category
